result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. BOSSHART II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any known drug dealers or users.

Defendant is to carry a picture of his son 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. BOSSHART II

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 09-03-2016
Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 09-03-2016
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 09-03-14 at 3:00 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 07-29-14 at 10:30 a.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY CONDITION OF BAIL- 
Attorney Larson moves to have the daily reporting condition discontinued for the days of July 4th through July 6th.  The defendant is planning to spend time with family out of town.  The State has no objection to this request.
The Court orders that the daily reporting condition be waived for July 4th, July 5th and July 6th.  The defendant must resume the daily reporting condition on July 7th.  All other terms of the bond remain in effect.  The defendant states he understands this.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

At 3:03 p.m., $100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  The matter is continued for a preliminary hearing on 07-01-14 at 3:00 p.m.  The $1,000.00 recongizance bond previously furnished is modified to $100.00 cash with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc County Jail, daily, by 9:00 p.m.  Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for preliminary hearing.   
Bench warrant authorized.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-23-14 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC - 2nd offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-14-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a commitment.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
